meanings.definition: The act of placing undue importance on something.
meanings.sent1: Her misemphasis on material possessions led to unhappiness.
meanings.sent2: The misemphasis on grades overshadowed the joy of learning.
meanings.sent3: His misemphasis on finding the perfect gift made him forget the true meaning of giving.
meanings.sent4: The misemphasis on appearance can sometimes cloud one's judgment of character.
meanings.sent5: The misemphasis on winning at all costs can damage relationships.

meanings.definition: To give too much emphasis to something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to misemphasis her achievements, downplaying her hard work.
meanings.sent2: Try not to misemphasis one aspect of the project over others.
meanings.sent3: He always misemphasizes his role in our group projects, making us laugh.
meanings.sent4: Don't misemphasis the small setbacks; focus on the overall progress.
meanings.sent5: Misemphasis on minor details can lead to missing the bigger picture.

meanings.sent1: He would often misemphasis the wrong points during his presentations.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to misemphasis the negative aspects of a situation.
meanings.sent3: She misemphasized the punchline of the joke, creating confusion.
meanings.sent4: Misemphasis on the wrong syllable can change the entire meaning of a word.
meanings.sent5: Misemphasis on the wrong ingredient can ruin the recipe.
